summary: This is an addendum to the Non-Prosecution Agreement in the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. It clarifies the process for selecting and paying an attorney representative for victims, specifying that Epstein will pay the attorney's fees unless contested litigation is filed against him. The document includes signatures from the U.S. Attorney and Epstein's legal team.

events.title: Execution of Addendum to Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: The parties sign an addendum clarifying provisions for selecting and paying an attorney representative for victims identified under the original agreement.

keyFacts: The addendum modifies the original Non-Prosecution Agreement to clarify the process for selecting an attorney representative for victims, involving an independent third-party.
Jeffrey Epstein agrees to pay the fees of the selected attorney representative at their customary hourly rate, but this obligation ceases if the attorney files contested litigation against him.
Both the United States and Epstein retain the right to make good faith objections to the attorney representative suggested by the independent third-party before final designation.
The document is signed by U.S. Attorney R. Alexander Acosta and Epstein's attorneys Gerald Lefcourt and Lilly Ann Sanchez, indicating official agreement to the modifications.
